item.description:
World Tai Chi & Qi Qong Day 2011

Saturday April 30, 2011
10:00 AM to 4:00 PM

Located on the Colchester Town Green

 

CT’s largest World Tai Chi & Qi Qong event has moved to Colchester Town Green...

World T’ai Chi & Qi Qong Day is an opportunity for people to participate in over 30 FREE tai chi and qigong classes provided by masters, experts, enthusiasts, and other students, and help to generate a world wide wave of peaceful, healing energy.

 

Come join us for what we expect to be a day full of fun, education and celebration of these two wonderful ancient Chinese martial and healing arts.

Details including directions and schedule for the day can be found by visiting: http://www.connecticuttaichi.us/

  

Directions to the Colchester Town Green

From Rte 2 North or South: Take exit 18 and follow Rte 16 East. Less than 1/2 mile on the right will be the Colchester Federated Church-park in the church parking lot. There is extra parking with access between the two small white houses. The Green is across Rte 85 from the church.

From Rte 66 East or West: Take Rte 85 South about 10 minutes. After Rte 85 turns left onto  roadway/Main St, the Green will be on your left where Rtes 16 & 85 merge. Some parking is available on Hayward Ave on the East side of the green. Additional parking at the Colchester Federated Church as notedabove.

Additional detail for people w/GPS: put in 60 Main St Colchester, CT for a destination (address of the church across from the green)

Bring a picnic, Bring a friend! 

Our event, and others like it, is part of the global World Tai Chi & Qi Qong Healing Wave that starts in New Zealand and migrates around the world with celebrations beginning at 10:00 AM in every time zone. We’ll start with a mass Qigong (Chinese energy healing technique) exercise led by Master Zhang Zhao Xun of the Hunyuan Tai Chi Chuan Academy of New Haven and Middletown, CT.

We invite Connecticut and local residents to join us for a day of FREE workshops and demonstrations presented by more than 17 local tai chi and qigong teachers and masters. A schedule of 28 workshops, 6 demonstrations and 2 mass qigong exercises will offer something for everyone, from the merely curious to the experienced practitioner.

Group qigong (Chi Kung)practice, led by an expert during the 2009 World Tai Chi Day Celebration, formerly held in Waterford,CT. This year’s event to be held on the Town Green in Colchester, CT.
item.how_to_find_us: meeting place will be emailed to Yes rsvps
item.why: You can bring a picnic and bring a friend!
item.name: World Tai Chi & Qi Qong Day 2011
